isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - PERFORMANCE DIAGNOSTICS - Test Procedures - Exhaust restriction

svcprocinfo.para: To check for restrictions in the exhaust system likely to cause engine performance problems

note.para: High intake or exhaust restriction can cause a large amount of black or blue smoke.

item.para: Electronic Service Tool (EST) with Master Diagnostics software

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the foreword of this manual. Follow all warnings, cautions, and notes.

step1.para: See Appendix A in this manual for specifications, and record on Performance Diagnostics form.
Inspect the entire exhaust system for damage and restriction.

note.para: When the EGR valve is disconnected, the ECM will set a DTC for the EGR valve position out of range low (163). Ignore the DTC and clear after the test is complete. If EGR is plugged in during the test, results will be incorrect.

step1.para: Open KOER Air Management.ssn to monitor EBP at high idle, no load.

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When running the engine in the service bay, make sure the parking brake is set, the transmission is in neutral, and the wheels are blocked.

step1.para: Run engine at high idle, no load.

item.para: If restriction is to spec, reconnect EGR valve, clear DTCs, and continue with Performance Diagnostics.
If restriction is above spec, remove exhaust pipe from turbocharger outlet and retest.
If restriction is to spec with exhaust pipe removed, reconnect EGR valve, clear DTCs, and correct problem between turbocharger outlet and the tail pipe.
If exhaust back pressure is still high with pipe removed from turbocharger outlet, reconnect EGR valve, clear DTCs, do Test 20 (Air Management).

svcsubproc.title: Monitoring EBP using pressure sensor breakout harness

figure.caption: Pressure sensor breakout harness installed - EBP

step1.para: Connect pressure sensor breakout harness to engine harness and EBP sensor.
Use DMM to measure EBP at high idle, no load.

item.para: Connect POS to green (signal circuit) and NEG to black (signal ground).

note.para: See Section 7 for operational voltages and values.

warning.para: To prevent serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle - comply with the following:
When running the engine in the service bay, make sure the parking brake is set, the transmission is in neutral, and the wheels are blocked.

step1.para: Run engine at high idle, no load.
Record results on Performance Diagnostics form.

item.para: If restriction is to spec, reconnect EGR valve, clear DTCs, and continue with Performance Diagnostics.
If restriction is above spec, remove exhaust pipe from turbocharger outlet and retest.
If restriction is to spec with exhaust pipe removed, reconnect EGR valve, clear DTCs, and correct problem between turbocharger outlet and the tail pipe.

If exhaust back pressure is still high with pipe removed from turbocharger outlet, reconnect EGR valve, clear DTCs. A defective turbocharger is suspect. A service tool is needed to run Test 20 (Air Management).
